definition: to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
music
happy/cheerful/to laugh
surname Yue
surname Le
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: The LORD finds us enough reasons for prayer, and we ought to thank Him that it is so.
sentences.chinese: 上帝乐意听我们的琐碎絮语，我们也该为此献上感谢。

sentences.english: Now you can drop the subscripts if you prefer.
sentences.chinese: 现在如果你乐意，可以去掉下标。

sentences.english: But he is proud to show off the scars and stitch-marks that cover his belly.
sentences.chinese: 但他却很乐意炫耀自己肚子上的刀疤和缝合的印记。

sentences.english: As a monitor, Bo Shi Wa is ready to help others.
sentences.chinese: 作为班长，博士蛙乐意帮助别人。

sentences.english: That mous actor seemed content to play a minor part in the play.
sentences.chinese: 那位名演员似乎很乐意在剧中扮演一个次要角色。

sentences.english: Weidong will be very glad to meet you and Mary.
sentences.chinese: 卫东非常乐意认识你和玛丽。

sentences.english: If you like, you can also dismember them.
sentences.chinese: 如果玩者乐意的话，还可以肢解受害者的尸体。

sentences.english: I also want to be a part of the conversations Googlers are having in the hallways.
sentences.chinese: 当然我也很乐意成为员工在走廊里谈话里的一部分。

sentences.english: Yes, if it wouldn''t take too long to arrange.
sentences.chinese: 若不会花太多时间安排的话我很乐意。

sentences.english: However, they can always give a suprise to those who are willing to do and help.
sentences.chinese: 但它总是能给予乐意行动和支付的人以惊喜。

sentences.english: I will gladly share more details if you have questions or clarifications.
sentences.chinese: 我会很乐意分享更多的细节，如果您有问题或澄清。

sentences.english: Countries which prefer to rely on America are happy to maintain the pretense.
sentences.chinese: 而倾向依赖于美国的国家也乐意保持这种虚假。

sentences.english: True to form, Finnie is much more interested in talking about her students.
sentences.chinese: 范尼还是一如既往地更乐意谈论她的学生们。

sentences.english: I would be happy to expedite and issue his U.S. visa myself.
sentences.chinese: 我本人将非常乐意加快签发他的美国签证。

sentences.english: Importer: Yes, if it wouldn't take too long to arrange.
sentences.chinese: 若不会花太多时间安排的话我很乐意。

sentences.english: I am sure Lizzy will be very happy -- I am sure she can have no objection.
sentences.chinese: 我相信丽萃也很乐意的，我相信她还会反对。

definition: to wish/to want/ready/willing (to do sth)
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
to care about/to take offense/to mind
old variant of 肯[ken3]
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to have the nerve/what a cheek!/to feel no shame/to overcome the shame/(is it) proper? (rhetorical question)
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
would rather/better
to show deference or praise publicly
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
unwilling
to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
